post.description: This method pushes updates to your your index data to Bing. This is an asynchronous process. To upload your index data to Bing, you'll send a push request that contains your index data.

parameters.name: SubscriptionId
parameters.description: Bing developer subcription id

parameters.name: notransform
parameters.description: This disables transformation config processing if the config was uploaded for some index. It's useful when the data is already transformed and is matching the index definition. Default is `false`

parameters.name: updateid
parameters.description: An id to uniquely identify the push update request in order to be able to track it down later.

parameters.name: tenantid
parameters.description: The ID that uniquely identifies the tenant that the index belongs to.

parameters.name: indexid
parameters.description: The ID that uniquely identifies the index definition to manage.

post.description: Upload a transformation config that you can use to test data transformation on the cloud.

parameters.name: SubscriptionId
parameters.description: Bing developer subcription id

parameters.name: tryoutid
parameters.description: The transformation tryout config id.

parameters.name: SubscriptionId
parameters.description: Bing developer subcription id

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The push data update document format.

Index.description: Contains the definition for the index. An index consists of a set of documents that search operations can be performed upon.

name.description: The index's name. The name must be unique per tenant, contain only ASCII characters, and have a maximum length of 64 characters.

description.description: A description of the index. The description is for the tenant's use. The description must contain only ASCII characters and have a maximum length of 64 characters.

regions.description: The array of regions where the customer data will be processed and served.

searchScenario.description: The type of search scenario that the user is using the index for, which includes Retail, Hotel, and Document.

searchServices.description: The array of additional search services that the user wants to include for the index, which includes Autosuggest and VisualSearch.

schemaVersion.description: The version for the schema of the index.

fields.description: The fields that are associated with the index.

IndexField.description: Contains the definition for the index field. A field represents a single unit of data.

facetable.description: Enables using the field for facets and other field-based aggregations.

filterable.description: Enables using the field in filter and boost conditions.

retrievable.description: Enables using the field values in search response.

searchable.description: Enables text matching on the field.

sortable.description: Enables sorting results by the field.

fieldLabel.description: A label to use with the field.

id.description: The ID that uniquely identifies the index definition that had the CRUD operation applied.

provisioningState.description: The current state of provisioning for the index definition.

createdDateTime.description: The date and time when the index was created.

IndexResponse.description: A response containing a list of indexes.

DeleteDocumentsResponse.description: A response containing the status for a request to delete documents from the index.

status.description: The status for the document deletion request.

errorMessage.description: An aggregation of error messages for errors that happened while processing the request, if any.

result.description: A list of status results per document.

Response.DocumentDeletionResult.description: A response representing the result of a request to delete a document from your index's catalog

documentId.description: The _itemid for the item item that has been deleted from the index.

deleted.description: A boolean flag that specifies whether or not the document has been successfully deleted.

errorMessage.description: An error message for the request, if any.

IndexStatusResponse.description: A response that represents the status of an index within its supported regions.

indexStatuses.description: A list of objects containing the status of the index within a region.

Response.IndexStatus.description: A response that represents a query to an index status within a region.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state for the index within the specified region.

provisioningPercentage.description: The percentage of provisioning for the index withing the region.

PushDataUpdateResponse.description: A response to a push data update.

updateId.description: The id of the push data update that you can use to track it down.

PushUpdateStatusResponse.description: A response that represents the status of a push data update given an update id.

updateId.description: The id that uniquely identifies the push data update.

status.description: The wholistic update status for the push data update.

totalKeys.description: The total number of items that are part of the upate.

successfulKeys.description: The total number of items that have successfully been updated.

failureMessages.description: An aggregation of any error messages that happened while ingesting any of the records.

records.description: A drill down for the push update status for each record.

Response.RecordStatus.description: A response that represents a status to a push data update for a record.

recordId.description: The _itemid for the record being updated.

status.description: The status for the push data update regarding the specified item id

errorMessage.description: An optional error message in case of an error while ingesting the record.

value.description: The contents of the transformation config that's being managed.

tryOutId.description: An id that you can use to tryout your transformation on the cloud.

TransformationTryoutResponse.description: A response representing the status of a transformation config tryout requset.

status.description: The status of the transformation config tryout.

errorMessage.description: Any error messages that happened while transforming, if any.

results.description: A list of records that the transformation config outputed.

consoleOutput.description: The console output of the transformation config, if any. Can be useful for debugging.
